1.brief: a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
Obadjah, the name of thirteen Israelites
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a hinge (as pressed in turning); also a throe (as a phys. or mental pressure); also a herald or erranddoer (as constrained by the principal)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

2.brief: abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

3.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to lead astray, i.e. (mentally) to delude, or (morally) to seduce
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
properly, session; but used also concretely, an abode or locality
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

4.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

5.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to be dumb or silent; hence, to fail or perish; trans. to destroy
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive
enough (as noun or adverb), used chiefly with preposition in phrases
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to swell up, i.e. be (causatively, make) redundant
only in plural gleanings; by extension gleaning-time

6.brief: to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask
Esav, a son of Isaac, including his posterity
to gush over, i.e. to swell; (figuratively) to desire earnestly; by implication to ask
a secret (place or thing, perhaps, treasure)

7.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
to lead astray, i.e. (mentally) to delude, or (morally) to seduce
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

8.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Esav, a son of Isaac, including his posterity

9.brief: properly, to prostrate; hence, to break down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear
Teman, the name of two Edomites, and of the region and descendant of one of them
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Esav, a son of Isaac, including his posterity

10.brief: violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
properly, to handle, i.e. to throw, e.g. lots
properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
